DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate Finding Qualitative Result
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The qualitative result of a laboratory test that involved testing a sample of blood for the level of erythrocyte sedimentation rate (esr, sedrate).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the results of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for the erythrocyte sedimentation rate, the rate at which red blood cells settle by mechanical means from a state of suspension.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Red blood cells. Mature erythrocytes are non-nucleated, biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.:The act or process of settling particles by mechanical means from a state of suspension in air or water.:A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.
The act or process of settling particles by mechanical means from a state of suspension in air or water.
A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A type of evaluation that is primarily descriptive and interpretative, and may or may not lend itself to quantification. Mainly concerned with the properties, the state, and the character (i.e., the nature) of phenomena. It implies an emphasis on processes and meanings that are rigorously examined, but not measured in terms of quantity, amount, or frequency. (www.unfpa.org/monitoring/toolkit/glossary.pdf and Nonprofit Good Practice Guide Glossary)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.
Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree or intensity or amount.

Concepts.definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Qualitative Evaluation Outcome
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test.:A type of evaluation that is primarily descriptive and interpretative, and may or may not lend itself to quantification. Mainly concerned with the properties, the state, and the character (i.e., the nature) of phenomena. It implies an emphasis on processes and meanings that are rigorously examined, but not measured in terms of quantity, amount, or frequency. (www.unfpa.org/monitoring/toolkit/glossary.pdf and Nonprofit Good Practice Guide Glossary):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The outcome of a laboratory test.

A type of evaluation that is primarily descriptive and interpretative, and may or may not lend itself to quantification. Mainly concerned with the properties, the state, and the character (i.e., the nature) of phenomena. It implies an emphasis on processes and meanings that are rigorously examined, but not measured in terms of quantity, amount, or frequency. (www.unfpa.org/monitoring/toolkit/glossary.pdf and Nonprofit Good Practice Guide Glossary)
